Summary Project/program manager skilled in driving communications between IT/QA/Business and cross functional groups as well as experience working with Change Management, Support and Release Management Organizations. Experience working with geographically dispersed groups. Successful Change Control lead for a large organization as well as running Release Readiness and Post Go Live Support projects. Extensive global training program management experience delivering world wide technical trainings. Program manage global training teams; Deliver training with the best-suited technology; Drive organizational efficiency by establishing effective processes and procedures; Strong research, presentation, communication and organizational skills; Course development that includes creation of End-User reference guides and documentation. Strong skills include running board meetings,developing project schedules, tracking multiple tasks, communicating status, managing complicated logistics and delivering under demanding deadlines. Member: PMI, ASTD. Specialties:Project Management Professional (PMP #1239441), ScrumMaster (CSM) Certification, Certificate in E-Learning Instructional Design, project/program management of geographically dispersed teams, global training program management. Detail oriented and able to see the big picture, effective communicator with all levels of management, ability to deliver under demanding deadlines. Wiki, Powerpoint, Excel, Work, MS Project, PPM, Dreamweaver Experience Project Manager Cisco 2014  – Present (1 year) San Jose, CA Project Manager for Outcomes based Implementation Programs Project Manager McAfee 2011  –  2014  (3 years) Santa Clara, CA Project Manager, Strategic Technology Partners IT Group 
 
Project manage the global rollout of an order management system that processes 75% of McAfee revenue leading geographically dispersed teams from various functional areas and working cross functionally with over 6 cross functional teams. 
 
Overall management of milestones and deliverables including development and maintenance of the Project Plan. 
•	Lead daily Development/QA status calls to drive the project schedule and obtain closure on action items.  
•	Determine and manage the release process and schedule for System Testing, UAT, Go Live Cutover, post go live production fixes and point releases. 
•	Work with QA team to project manage Failover/Failback testing. Work with Order Operations and IT Analyst for UAT. 
•	Create and manage change requests. Present requests to the Change Assessment Board. 
•	Develop and deliver Change Management; Communications; Go Live Cutover and Post Go Live Support plans. 
•	Project manage delivery of SOX controls, Disaster Recovery and Small Order Automation Projects. 
 
Manage, control, monitor issues, risks and mitigation. 
 
Presentation and Communications 
o	Facilitate bi-weekly status meetings with Steering Committee; daily sunrise calls; and daily working sessions or weekly checkpoints with business, QA, Development, Production Support, Enterprise Architecture Support teams as necessary. 
o Deliver weekly communications of project status via Powerpoint slide presentations, Sharepoint and Navigator (Project Management software) reports to Steering Committee, PMO Governance and other stakeholders. Project Manager Cisco Systems May 2010  –  May 2011  (1 year 1 month) Promoted March 2011 as the Lead of PMO Shared Services Team – within 10 months of starting in this group. 
 
Lead the Cisco Services Commerce Change Control Board (CCB) that manages changes requests (CR) of all service and subscription business applications ($2.6 billion business) 
 
Implement the agreed upon CCB process designed to ensure that all impacted teams understand the scope of the change, minimize scope creep and manage code contention across the organization. This project and process is 100% virtual. 
 
Drive effective bi-weekly board meetings with over 80 members world-wide with change request presentations, questions and discussions, assessment and follow-ups. 
 
Learned new role in two months to execute the change request assessment process from 65% to 95% completion within the 5-day SLA agreement. 
 
Report CR status at weekly Cisco Services Release meetings. 
 
Collaborate with Release Management Organizations regarding release scopes and change requests 
 
Develop and deliver metrics at tollgates in the release process. 
 
Technologies used: WebEx; PowerPoint; PROPEL: Project Management document repository; Wiki; EDM: Enterprise Data Management document repository 
 
Create slide decks and conduct trainings for stakeholders (virtually in groups or individually). 
 
Design Wiki pages to display relevant release related information and CCB training slide decks and documents. 
 
Organize the EDM structure for the team. 
 
Readiness Review Lead for quarterly releases. 
 
Drive the review process with Program Leads to minimize risks in 1st and 2nd test cycles. 
 
Present overall status to Executive Leadership for Go/No Go decision. 
 
PMO Shift Lead for Post Go-Live support release of mission critical world-wide applications. 
 
Drive support processes for effective function of the War Room. 
 
Provide effective escalation management of issues. Program Manager, Student Services Stanford University January 2006  –  February 2007  (1 year 2 months) Managed the department's graduate colloquium, directed graduate assistants, maintained the colloquium website. 
 
Organized and managed the department's commencement ceremony. 
 
Wrote and designed a marketing poster and brochure that increased the graduate applicant pool by 50%. 
 
Became fully productive in two weeks, learned a new database system, two processes, and two software applications. Portal Program Manager for Developer Portal Group, Forte for Java (FFJ) Sun Microsystems 2001  –  2002  (1 year) Key player in integrating a third party company (Forte) into Sun. 
1. Took the initiative to set up and run integration meetings between engineers from Sun and Forte 
2. Enabled transfer of Third Party Forte software into Sun ensuring that all of Sun's legal guidelines were met 
 
Developed and launched AMP (Added Modules Program) to enable Partners to submit modules to the FFJ; created an AMP program plan for partners and internal contributors; created and lead the AMP team; worked across eight functional groups Program Manger of Technology Based Training, Global Training Resources (GTR) Sun Microsystems 2000  –  2001  (1 year) Provided e-training for service engineers worldwide to support products effectively by product release dates. 
 
Researched available and emerging e-technologies as alternatives to classroom teaching. Led new program. 
 
Selected Placeware and negotiated vendor contract. 
 
Led a virtual team of three people to create and test e-training infrastructure based on Placeware. 
 
Convinced manager to use unproven technology at Sun under severe budget constraints. 
 
Synchronized delivery of the class with global training team. 
 
Delivered ten live world-wide trainings over four months. Reduced travel expenses by more than 50% per class with 90% customer satisfaction. 
 
Designed, maintained and developed content for a central website with information on e-technologies. Site was referenced in SunU classes and in a company news article. Technical Training Program Manager for Systems Engineers, SunU Sun Microsystems 1999  –  2000  (1 year) Redesigned the SE training website to improve navigation and customer satisfaction 
 
Established process to re-design the site, implemented changes using HTML, improved website navigation and doubled customer satisfaction. 
 
Doubled training revenue in nine months  
 
Worked with field managers and SEs to determine technical tracks for Technical and Professional Curriculum Maps. 
 
Created new courses, marketed and promoted program to the field. Tracked revenue for regular reports; Used an in-house LMS for effective course management. 
 
Managed the program and delivered training, increased SE course offerings by 25%. Program Manager of Worldwide Technical Training, Enterprise Services Sun Microsystems 1998  –  1999  (1 year) Developed departmental processes to reduce the Support Readiness Training (SRT) development time.  
 
Wrote and implemented processes such as Materials Acquisition and Review processes for Train the Trainer programs, reduced SRT development time by 50%. 
 
Developed an Initial Training Strategy Data chart to track new products, increased communication with groups in ES. Project Coordinator, Enterprise Services Sun Microsystems 1997  –  1998  (1 year) Redesigned the Project Life Cycle (PLC) intranet site to improve usability and create a standard look and feel 
 
Minimized number of clicks to access and navigate website and created site map increasing user satisfaction by 100%. 
 
Learned and used PERL, JavaScript and HTML in two months to design and develop a web-based “Acronym Search Tool” to facilitate decoding acronyms.
